Package com.paigegoldhagen.astral

Class EventsHandler

java.lang.Object
com.paigegoldhagen.astral.EventsHandler
public class EventsHandler extends Object
For calculating projected event times and getting the upcoming events list.

  • Constructor Summary

    Description

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    static List<LocalTime>
    getProjectedEventTimes(Events event)
    Get the scheduled event times or calculate the projected event times over a 24-hour period using the initial start time and the frequency of the event.
    static List<UpcomingEvents>
    getUpcomingEvents(List<Timetable> timetable, String notifyTime, String notifyState, LocalTime utcTime)
    Store upcoming events in the UpcomingEvents class if the event notification time matches UTC time and if notifications for the event are enabled.

  • Constructor Details

    • EventsHandler

      public EventsHandler()

  • Method Details

    • getProjectedEventTimes

      public static List<LocalTime> getProjectedEventTimes(Events event)
      Get the scheduled event times or calculate the projected event times over a 24-hour period using the initial start time and the frequency of the event.
      Parameters:
      event - the event data to get the event schedule or initial start time and frequency
      Returns:
      a list of LocalTime times associated with an event

    • getUpcomingEvents

      public static List<UpcomingEvents> getUpcomingEvents(List<Timetable> timetable, String notifyTime, String notifyState, LocalTime utcTime)
      Store upcoming events in the UpcomingEvents class if the event notification time matches UTC time and if notifications for the event are enabled.
      Parameters:
      timetable - the list of events with name, location, and projected event times
      notifyTime - the user choice for the notification reminder in minutes
      notifyState - the user choices for receiving notifications per event
      utcTime - the current time in UTC
      Returns:
      a list of upcoming events
